abstract: John Breit, the former top risk manager at Merrill Lynch, says that mathematical models fail because they don’t account for human frailty.
snippet: John Breit, the former top risk manager at Merrill Lynch, says that mathematical models fail because they don’t account for human frailty.
lead_paragraph: When he left physics, John Breit had the choice of a job in naval intelligence or on Wall Street. “My wife said I couldn’t be a spy. She hates capitalism, but said to go to Wall Street,” he told me recently. “And then I ended up running a spy network.”

headline.main: Finding the Human Factor in Bank Risk
headline.print_headline: Uncovering the Human Factor in Risk Management Models
